features: A versatile air fryer and multi-cooker that elevates practically any meal, from air frying quick after-school snacks to roasting for large gatherings.
24 cooking pre-sets provide a variety of cooking methods: Ribs, Defrost, Bake, Toast, Chicken, Pizza, Pastry, Slow Cook, Roast, Reheat, and Keep Warm.
Dual-Speed Fan Homemade cooking & golden fried crisping at it's finest with 360º superheated air circulation.

A stainless steel exterior provides a beautiful asthetic to any kitchen, taking your party hosting to the next level. And Elegant French doors open with a single pull – interior light allows you to monitor food
Extra-large 26-quart capacity serves 4–6 people – rotisserie a 6-lb chicken, bake a 12” pizza

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: High-speed accelerated air flow cooks & crisps food faster with even doneness on two separate cooking levels. Precisely cooked, family-sized meals are hot, crisp & ready to serve faster than traditional oven appliances. Die-cast grill plate locks in juices and outdoor barbecue flavor with char-grill marks.

Bake, air fry, toast, rotisserie, roast... & broil functions take care of almost all your cooking needs. Indulge in your favorite golden-fried food with up to 70% fewer calories from fat. One-handed opening provides ease during cooking while bringing a sleek, elegant look to any kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, I love it! (Its definitely love)
reviews.reviewText: Update: I’ve been using this oven for a couple months now for roasting, baking, broiling, air frying, and reheating. It is an outstanding oven that performs flawlessly every time. The oven heats evenly, so baked goods cook uniformly. Over the holidays I baked cookies, and since then enchiladas, cornbread, casseroles, sheet pan meals, hot wings, salmon, quesadillas, broiled sandwiches, etc. I love the amount of cooking space available and it doesn’t take up too much counter space. This is the best toaster oven I’ve owned. Absolutely love it!We purchased this oven to replace our Ninja Foodie flip-up air fryer/toaster oven which we’ve had for just over a year. We are full-time RVers and seldom bother to light and use the gas oven in our RV, so it’s very important to me that I have a good countertop oven. With limited space, I love that it doubles as an air fryer, too. We have a separate toaster because I’ve never been satisfied with the way a toaster oven toasts (sounds silly, but give me a pop-up toaster any day).I never liked our old oven because it’s not tall enough inside to cook in anything but a tray. It was also not heating properly and I was very disappointed with the results. It don’t heat properly and was too small to bake a cake or roast a whole chicken.I spent a lot of time researching other combination air fryer/ovens until I came upon this oven. I will update later, but I was very impressed with the cooking performance of my first meal - a sheet pan meal with Parmesan-crusted chicken breasts and broccoli. I baked it for 14 minutes at 425°, turning the broccoli half way through. The chicken was perfectly cooked - juicy inside with a golden brown, crusty topping. The broccoli had the right amount of char without being over or undercooked. I was amazed how much better it roasted than the old oven and I like the way the baking tray just slips into the slots on the side. This meal wasn’t very messy, so there wasn’t much splatter and there were no drips to clean.Today I’m baking cookies and tomorrow I’m air frying wings, so I will update after I’ve used it a few more times. We buy meal kits from Green Chef, and many of the recipes require baking. Since there are just two of us, this will definitely do the trick.This is a very preliminary review, but the positives include: roomy interior cooking space, easy to bake with a 9” square pan, pie pan, or 12” cookie sheet. Evenly heats and the temperature was consistent with a thermometer. It didn’t overheat the room and we keep a 4-6” space from walls. The interior light is bright. I like the double doors, but be sure there is enough space to fully open them so they don’t close on your hand - especially if it’s hot! There are many simple settings and it’s easy to adjust the temperature and time. I’m looking forward to experimenting more! The only negative so far is that it can’t accommodate the 12” pizza pan that worked with the old oven. This isn’t a problem because I’ve found frozen pizza is best when cooked on the wire rack instead of in a pan. We use our outdoor pizza oven for homemade pizza anyway.We will definitely stay on top of cleaning it after each use, wiping off splatters & drips that can smoke up the kitchen. It’s not likely we will use the rotisserie because I’m sure it would be very messy, but it’s going to be great for baking, roasting & air frying.More later after I’ve used this for a few months, but if you’ve been considering getting this while it’s on sale - go for it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My go to cooking device
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this thing. Cooks quickly, easy to clean . Works great for fries, pizza rolls, frozen egg rolls, so much better than a microwave and not much more time.I’ve also broiled steak and roasts which with the help of my IQ thermometer cook in 60% of the time and turn out very good and even crust up a bit.Easy to set up and pretty easy to use, I’ve yet to read the included recipe book. I bought it Black Friday and have used it more than my oven.It is a bit bulky but I purposely bought one big enough to do rotisserie, which I haven tried yet but it’s coming soon.The purchase was inspired by the air fryer we got the previous Christmas. We enjoyed it but the basket was too small for a dinner for 4. This one can cook a real meal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality! You won’t regret buying this!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my son as a gift. He was blown away by all the features and truly loves and enjoys using this oven. It’s got a nice large cooking area, the air fryer, and rotisserie that all work great! He was able to put a cooking stone in it and is able to cook a 12in pizza! It’s like a real oven but more practical for his kitchenette area. Great buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Item is nice to use but it would be much better if it had independent temp controls on each compartment. Also ours had a steam leak that started within about two weeks of use so we are getting a replacement. Nice unit and looks good on the counter top, cooks very nicely, but could use some updates. We found that cleaning was a little bit of a challenge but doable. Things stick to the basket and you need to use a scrubber on the accessories. Amazon customer service was very helpful in getting the replacement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Overall my favorite kitchen air fryer I've ever had. Easy programming and cooking instrument. Solid sturdy French doors and the outer cabinet stays cool to the touch. Well worth the money from Emerils line.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My range has practically been retired
reviews.reviewText: Supper impressed and happy. I use it constantly for everything, it's just made cooking everything better and easier. I've roasted quite a few chickens I have air fried chicken, I've rotisseried chicken drums or thighs on the rotisserie which is great, you can get you some nice crispy skin that way. Number one tip is make sure to take the drip pan out and line it with aluminum foil so it makes for easy cleaning and saves you a lot of time. Oh and for those that want to know... I don't think I'll ever cook a steak any differently other than a barbecue ever again. Their Grill platter is fantastic and the preheat mode before cooking makes sure that it is nice and hot so when you drop your steak on there it is immediately sizzling loudly, it gets the job done real nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Roomy and works great
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded to this from the regular sized Emeril oven, and I love this one better. I love the French doors and love it is bigger inside. It has the grill function, though be careful to watch closely as you can dry out meats quickly on this function. I love that it will shut off where my other one did not. I am so glad that I upgraded to this version of the Emeril oven. If you are looking for a multi-purpose oven, this is the one to get.

When unpacking this oven we found the door on the right hand side does not meet up with the door on the left we were told to send it back we were sent a return postage sticker. This is a heavy item it was deiivered by truck how do we get it picked up??? We are so disappointed. All we wanted was a stove we purchased it in good faith we repurchased this oven and are glad we did. We love it we now see that there is a double size. Two sided I wish we had waited. It looks great.Thank you
Muy contento con la compra, por lo pronto ¡¡

reviews.reviewTitle: Better build quality than the plastic door models, easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I had a slightly smaller model of a different brand that had a plastic outside case and door and it broke into pieces and the door feel off from poor quality plastic.This is all metal and glass except for small non structural pieces on the handle.The only downside is the door can get a bit hot from being made of metal. Be careful not to burn yourself. I think it will last longer as a result though. And it works great.My model came with the grilling plate and I love it.The drip tray is removable and catches crumbs well, but to help keep the inside clean for many types of cooking, I also recommend getting third party stainless steel 12.5x9.5 inch baking pans that come with raised baking grills. It will let the air fryer circulate while catching more significant amounts of sauce and greasy drips.
